quiz.title: Unit 5: Circular Motion and Gravity (Quiz 3)
quiz.subtitle: Angular Speed and Centripetal Acceleration (10 Questions)
quiz.subject: Physics

questions.question: An object has a period of rotation equal to 4 seconds. What is its angular speed in radians per second?
An object moves in a circular path with frequency 4 hertz and radius 0.2 meters. What is its tangential speed?
An object completes 10 revolutions in 5 seconds of circular motion. What is the period of its motion?
What does the word 'centripetal' literally mean?
If an object is in uniform circular motion, what is the value of its tangential acceleration?
options: It is equal to the centripetal acceleration.
questions.explanation: Uniform circular motion means constant speed, so tangential acceleration = 0.

questions.question: The centripetal acceleration vector is always oriented _________ to the instantaneous velocity vector.
questions.explanation: Centripetal acceleration points toward center (radial), velocity is tangent, so they are perpendicular.

questions.question: According to the formula $a_c = v^2/r$, if the speed of an object is doubled while the radius remains the same, the centripetal acceleration will:
questions.explanation: $a_c \propto v^2$, so doubling speed quadruples acceleration.

questions.question: If a car moves around a curve with a larger radius at the same speed, the centripetal acceleration will:
questions.explanation: $a_c = v^2/r$, so larger radius at same speed gives smaller acceleration.

questions.question: Which component of acceleration is responsible for changing the speed of an object in non-uniform circular motion?
questions.explanation: Tangential acceleration changes speed; centripetal (radial) changes direction.

questions.question: The 'feeling' of being flung outward when a car turns quickly is actually due to:
questions.explanation: Inertia makes you want to continue straight; car turns, so relative to car you feel flung outward.
